package.config.path: Path and filename of the git executable, e.g. `C:\Program Files\Git\bin\git.exe` (Windows). This can also be an array of string values containing multiple paths to look up.
package.config.autoRepositoryDetection: Configures when repositories should be automatically detected.
package.config.autoRepositoryDetection.true: Scan for both subfolders of the current opened folder and parent folders of open files.
package.config.autoRepositoryDetection.subFolder: Scan for subfolders of the currently opened folder.
package.config.autoRepositoryDetection.openEdito: Scan for parent folders of open files.
package.config.autofetch: When set to true, commits will automatically be fetched from the default remote of the current Git repository. Setting to `all` will fetch from all remotes
package.config.autofetchPeriod: Duration in seconds between each automatic git fetch, when `git.autofetch` is enabled.
package.config.checkoutType: Controls what type of git refs are listed when running `Checkout to...`.
package.config.branchValidationRegex: A regular expression to validate new branch names.
package.config.branchWhitespaceChar: The character to replace whitespace in new branch names.
package.config.ignoreMissingGitWarning: Ignores the warning when Git is missing.
package.config.ignoreWindowsGit27Warning: Ignores the warning when Git 2.25 - 2.26 is installed on Windows.
package.config.ignoreLimitWarning: Ignores the warning when there are too many changes in a repository.
package.config.ignoreRebaseWarning: Ignores the warning when it looks like the branch might have been rebased when pulling.
package.config.defaultCloneDirectory: The default location to clone a git repository.
package.config.enableSmartCommit: Commit all changes when there are no staged changes.
package.config.smartCommitChanges: Control which changes are automatically staged by Smart Commit.
package.config.suggestSmartCommit: Suggests to enable smart commit (commit all changes when there are no staged changes).
package.config.enableCommitSigning: Enables commit signing with GPG or X.509.
package.config.discardAllScope: Controls what changes are discarded by the `Discard all changes` command. `all` discards all changes. `tracked` discards only tracked files. `prompt` shows a prompt dialog every time the action is run.
package.config.decorations.enabled: Controls whether Git contributes colours and badges to the explorer and the open editors view.
package.config.enableStatusBarSync: Controls whether the Git Sync command appears in the status bar.
package.config.followTagsWhenSync: Follow push all tags when running the sync command.
package.config.promptToSaveFilesBeforeStash: Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before stashing changes.
package.config.promptToSaveFilesBeforeStash.stag: Check only for unsaved staged files.
package.config.promptToSaveFilesBeforeCommit: Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before committing.
package.config.promptToSaveFilesBeforeCommit.sta: Check only for unsaved staged files.
package.config.postCommitCommand: Runs a git command after a successful commit.
package.config.postCommitCommand.none: Don't run any command after a commit.
package.config.postCommitCommand.push: Run 'Git Push' after a successful commit.
package.config.postCommitCommand.sync: Run 'Git Sync' after a successful commit.
package.config.openAfterClone: Controls whether to open a repository automatically after cloning.
package.config.openAfterClone.alwaysNewWindow: Always open in a new window.
package.config.openAfterClone.whenNoFolderOpen: Only open in current window when no folder is opened.
package.config.showInlineOpenFileAction: Controls whether to show an inline Open File action in the Git changes view.
package.config.showPushSuccessNotification: Controls whether to show a notification when a push is successful.
package.config.inputValidation: Controls when to show commit message input validation.
package.config.inputValidationLength: Controls the commit message length threshold for showing a warning.
package.config.inputValidationSubjectLength: Controls the commit message subject length threshold for showing a warning. Unset it to inherit the value of `config.inputValidationLength`.
package.config.detectSubmodules: Controls whether to automatically detect git submodules.
package.config.detectSubmodulesLimit: Controls the limit of git submodules detected.
package.config.alwaysShowStagedChangesResourceGr: Always show the Staged Changes resource group.
package.config.alwaysSignOff: Controls the signoff flag for all commits.
package.config.ignoreSubmodules: Ignore modifications to submodules in the file tree.
package.config.ignoredRepositories: List of git repositories to ignore.
package.config.scanRepositories: List of paths to search for git repositories in.
package.config.showProgress: Controls whether Git actions should show progress.
package.config.rebaseWhenSync: Force git to use rebase when running the sync command.
package.config.confirmEmptyCommits: Always confirm the creation of empty commits for the 'Git: Commit Empty' command.
package.config.fetchOnPull: When enabled, fetch all branches when pulling. Otherwise, fetch just the current one.
package.config.autoStash: Stash any changes before pulling and restore them after successful pull.
package.config.allowForcePush: Controls whether force push (with or without lease) is enabled.
package.config.useForcePushWithLease: Controls whether force pushing uses the safer force-with-lease variant.
package.config.confirmForcePush: Controls whether to ask for confirmation before force-pushing.
package.config.allowNoVerifyCommit: Controls whether commits without running pre-commit and commit-msg hooks are allowed.
package.config.confirmNoVerifyCommit: Controls whether to ask for confirmation before commiting without verification.
package.config.openDiffOnClick: Controls whether the diff editor should be opened when clicking a change. Otherwise the regular editor will be opened.
package.config.supportCancellation: Controls whether a notification comes up when running the Sync action, which allows the user to cancel the operation.
package.config.branchSortOrder: Controls the sort order for branches.
package.config.untrackedChanges.mixed: All changes, tracked and untracked, appear together and behave equally.
package.config.untrackedChanges.separate: Untracked changes appear separately in the Source Control view. They are also excluded from several actions.
package.config.untrackedChanges.hidden: Untracked changes are hidden and excluded from several actions.
package.config.requireGitUserConfig: Controls whether to require explicit Git user configuration or allow Git to guess if missing
package.config.showCommitInput: Controls whether to show the commit input in the Git source control panel.
package.config.terminalAuthentication: Controls whether to enable VS Code to be the authentication handler for git processes spawned in the integrated terminal. Note: terminals need to be restarted to pick up a change in this setting.
package.config.timeline.showAuthor: Controls whether to show the commit author in the Timeline view
package.config.timeline.date: Controls which date to use for items in the Timeline view
package.config.useCommitInputAsStashMessage: Controls whether to use the message from the commit input box as the default stash message.
package.colors.stageModified: Color for modified resources which have been staged.
package.colors.stageDeleted: Color for deleted resources which have been staged.
package.colors.renamed: Color for renamed or copied resources.
package.view.workbench.scm.missing:
A valid git installation was not detected, more details can be found in the [git output](command:git.showOutput).
Please [install git](https://git-scm.com/), or learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code in [our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
If you're using a different version control system, you can [search the Marketplace](command:workbench.extensions.search?%22%40category%3A%5C%22scm%20providers%5C%22%22) for additional extensions.
package.view.workbench.scm.disabled:
If you would like to use git features, please enable git in your [settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22git.enabled%22%5D).
To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
package.view.workbench.scm.empty:
In order to use git features, you can open a folder containing a git repository or clone from a URL.
[Open Folder](command:vscode.openFolder)
[Clone Repository](command:git.clone)
To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
package.view.workbench.scm.folder:
The folder currently open doesn't have a git repository. You can initialize a repository which will enable source control features powered by git.
[Initialize Repository](command:git.init?%5Btrue%5D)
To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
package.view.workbench.scm.workspace:
The workspace currently open doesn't have any folders containing git repositories. You can initialize a repository on a folder which will enable source control features powered by git.
[Initialize Repository](command:git.init)
To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
package.view.workbench.scm.emptyWorkspace:
The workspace currently open doesn't have any folders containing git repositories.
[Add Folder to Workspace](command:workbench.action.addRootFolder)
To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
package.view.workbench.cloneRepository:
You can also clone a repository from a URL. To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
[Clone Repository](command:git.clone 'Clone a repository once the git extension has activated')
